page.title: 19SOCIAL CONCERNS
page.content: HEAVY TRAFFIC People are concerned about the dangers to pedestrians and the damage to buildings caused by heavy lorries coming through our quiet villages and narrow roads. Here are two examples of accidents involving heavy lorries: about two years ago the Wonersh Pepperpot was knocked down by a goods lorry. The Pepperpot, with resting seats, was situated in the middle of the crossroads. About a year ago, a lorry was travelling through Bramley when a loosely tied piece of metal slid off the vehicle and injured an old lady. The sheet of metal then passed through a shop window and could have harmed shoppers inside. Pedestrians are particularly vulnerable in Bramley as there are a number of schools there and children travel to and fro at peak times.
